bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to Edwin F. Uhl, August 23, 1894
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Consulate-General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, August 23, 1894.

p.add: INDEX BUREAU RECEIVED OCT 11 94 DEPT OF STATE

div1.p: Mr. Beverly Y. Payne, to the Department of State.
Consulate-General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, August 23, 1894.
Honorable Edwin F. Uhl, Assistant Sec'y of State, Washington, D. C.

Sir: I have the honor to acknwoledge receipt of your No. 9. of 9th ult., enclosing a copy of Circular of September 19, 1893, calling my attention to the transmission of Consular Agent's return at Elmina, and inquiring the exact location of said Consular Agency. I beg to say in reply that it is at Elmina, king the residence of the consular agent, but Cape Coast Castle is the principle sea port town
I have transmitted to the Consular Agent there a copy of the Circular referred to and I am of the opinion it will be observed in future.
I have the honor to be Sir: your obedient servant,
Beverly Y. Payne, U.S. Vice Consul.
